This is opinion

I'm still waiting for proof of an actual crisis. What we are seeing is the natural process doing exactly what it's done for eons now. There is no slowing or stopping climate change, as I already stated it's a naturally occurring process. I will agree that our efforts should be focused less on trying to reverse or slow this process and more so on adapting to the inevitable changes this process is bringing our way.
CO2 atmosphere levels are irrelevant, as it doesn't play a role in warming. Historical data also reflects this, global temperatures will rise, and then we'll see an associated climb in CO2, as global temperatures fall, we see a decline in CO2 levels as well. CO2 levels follow warming and cooling periods, they don't cause them. CO2 accounts for 0.04% of the atmosphere (even at 440ppm, which is relatively low compared to historical data as well), and yet is somehow blamed for warming. Water vapor in the atmosphere is what is causing heat retention, not CO2.
As far as the weather phenomenon, this is more related to solar activity (solar minimum) and the shifting magnetic poles than mythical anthropogenic climate change.

Our lives are too short to figure things out.  We spend 18 years growing up, another handful catching up on previous discoveries, then we only devote on average 40 hours of week to work.  We spend a ton of time dating, socializing, having fun, sleeping, eating, and taking care of our homes and family.  Many of us don't work on these issues at all and those who do only get a 45 year crack at it until retirement.
